briefTitle: Stroke Telemedicine Outpatient Prevention Program for Blood Pressure Reduction
officialTitle: Stroke Telemedicine Outpatient Program (STOP) for Blood Pressure Reduction

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Ischemic and hemorrhagic stroke patients
* Presence of at least one of the following high risk criteria: uninsured, Medicaid payer status, small vessel ischemic stroke, hypertensive ICH)
* Age ≥ 18; presence of hypertension (by clinical history or hospital BP ≥140/90 on two occasions)
* Plan to discharge home after stroke
* Ability to provide consent (patient or caregiver)
* Ability to communicate in English

Exclusion Criteria:

* modified Rankin scale \> 4 at the time of enrollment (severe disability)
* life expectancy \< 1 year or terminal illness,
* eGFR \< 30 at time of discharge
* pregnancy
* symptomatic flow limiting carotid stenosis without plan for intervention
* urine toxicology positive for cocaine or methamphetamine or recent use
* long-term BP goal ≥ 130/80 mmHg according to clinical team

primary.description: Blood pressure will be assessed with an ambulatory blood pressure monitor (ABPM).

secondary.description: Blood pressure will be assessed with an ambulatory blood pressure monitor (ABPM).

secondary.measure: Night Time Ambulatory Systolic Blood Pressure
secondary.description: Blood pressure will be assessed with an ambulatory blood pressure monitor (ABPM).
Blood pressure will be assessed with an ambulatory blood pressure monitor (ABPM).
BMI will be calculated from height and weight.

secondary.measure: Number of Participants With Recurrent Vascular Events (Stroke, Myocardial Infarction, Acute Cardiac Death)
secondary.description: Recurrent vascular events include stroke, myocardial infarction, or acute cardiac death.

secondary.measure: Number of Participants With Acute Healthcare Utilization
secondary.description: Acute healthcare utilization includes hospital readmission and acute care visits to emergency room and/or urgent care.

other.measure: Caregiver Burden as Assessed by the Zarit Caregiver Burden Questionnaire
Medication Adherence as Assessed by the Morisky Medication Adherence Scale (MMAS)
Self-efficacy for Taking Medication as Prescribed as Assessed by the Medication Adherence Self-Efficacy Scale (MASES)
